CatDescriptText: Mrs. Manly Stevens, homemaker, Homewood was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 10, 1960, pg. B1 with question: "Do you favor governmental (state or Federal) aid to education, which would help promising students further their educations, or do you believe that the rising cost of education should be defrayed entirely by the student, his or her parents or relatives?" answer reads: "If we had better jobs, the families could educate their children well."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Manly Stevens wearing dark head scarf, plaid coat, and dark knit gloves, holding "Gimbels" bag, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
